item.title: Wondering: One Bullet Away From What?
item.description: Just how far can the United States push Pakistan’s Pervez Musharraf?
item.author: MARK MAZZETTI

item.title: Don’t Be Cruel: Voters Accept Divorced Candidates, but They Have Limits
item.description: The American public may not mind if presidential hopefuls have personally checkered lives, but will they be able to stomach adultery?
item.author: JOYCE PURNICK

item.title: Correspondence: Reporters and Sources Slowed Their Dance to Show the Steps
item.description: Taking stock of the I. Lewis Libby case, secrecy and White House credibility.
item.author: DAVID E. SANGER

item.title: Ideas & Trends: Lotto Makes Sense, Even for Losers
item.description: The fantasy of winning stimulates the same brain circuits that winning does.
item.author: BENEDICT CAREY

item.title: Seven One Eight: To Reach Me in Russia, Just Dial Brooklyn
item.description: A touch-tone phone and a computer are all you need to never quite leave home.
item.author: CLIFFORD J. LEVY

item.title: Off the Job: And I’m Not Your ‘Girl,’ Gramps
item.description: Grout-scrubbing, lechery and insults are the perils of being a home health aide, now the fastest-growing occupation in America.
item.author: JANE GROSS
